intro: Halenia deflexa var. heterantha, commonly known as the variable halenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are usually alternate and pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
